content.raw:
More of a general question that applies to this data structure but not only.  
There seem to be a lot of cases in which we use map in cases in which we don’t need an ordered data structure but we only do lookup by key and assignment.

Using a map makes both insertion and lookup logN in complexity while if we used a normal unordered\_map those should be \(amortized\) constant complexity.

Is there a reason there is such a large use of maps? For this specific case I’m guessing that you expect the map to be quite small hence the overhead of a hash map might not be worth it?
